p: Free radicals are organic or inorganic molecules that have atoms that contain one or more unpaired electrons [ 118]. The majority of free radicals observed are superoxide (O 2 −), hydroxyl (OH −), hydroperoxide (HO 2 −), nitric oxide (NO •), and nitrogen dioxide (NO 2 •). Among these, the hydroxyl radical is the most reactive in the induction of cellular lesions and hydrogen peroxide can cross the nuclear membrane and induce damage in the DNA molecule [ 119, 120].
